message.content:
cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.CL

The paper focuses on content-based movie recommendation, which involves information retrieval (IR) techniques to extract relevant features from the movie content. The use of textual information from subtitles and topic modeling also suggests a focus on natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) techniques, which are commonly found in the cs.CL and cs.LG sub-categories. The extraction of visual and auditory features also suggests a focus on computer vision (CV) and multimedia (MM) analysis, which are commonly found in the cs.CV and cs.MM sub-categories. Overall, the paper covers a wide range of CS sub-categories, but the emphasis on content-based recommendation and feature extraction suggests a stronger association with cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.CV, and cs.CL.
